MASTER_PAD_VERSION_INFO.MASTER_PAD_INFO: Portable Application Description, or PAD for short, is a data set that is used by shareware authors to disseminate information to anyone interested in their software products. To find out more go to http://www.asp-shareware.org/pad

English.Keywords: autorun, autoplay, auto start, auto run CD , autorun DVD, make autorun
English.Char_Desc_45: Software to quickly author autorun.inf files
English.Char_Desc_80: A program that can be used to quickly and easily create autorun.inf files
English.Char_Desc_250: The Autorun.inf Editor is a program that can be used to quickly and easily create autorun CD autorun.inf files. An autorun.inf file is a required file when creating an autorun CD.
English.Char_Desc_450: The Autorun.inf Editor is a program that can be used to quickly and easily create autorun CD autorun.inf files. An autorun.inf file is a required file when creating an autorun CD. When a CD is put into the drive, the operating system looks for the autorun.inf file. If the file exists, it reads the file and then knows how to "autoplay" the CD. There are a number of things you can do with an autorun.inf file.
English.Char_Desc_2000:
The Autorun.inf Editor is a program that can be used to quickly and easily create autorun CD autorun.inf files. An autorun.inf file is a required file when creating an autorun CD. When a CD is put into the drive, the operating system looks for the autorun.inf file. If the file exists, it reads the file and then knows how to "autoplay" the CD. There are a number of things you can do with an autorun.inf file.
The Autorun.inf Editor was created as a free utility to make it easy for people to generate their own autorun.inf files. With the editor you can create an autorun.inf file that can:
-Set a label for the CD (this label will be displayed in My Computer and Explorer on a Windows computer) -Set an icon for the CD -Specify a program on the CD (or user's computer) to run when the CD is inserted -Add entries and commands to the context menu for when a user right-clicks on the CD
